recipe_card: Slow Cooker Pulled Pork Tacos 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (6-pound) pork shoulder roast"},{"recipe_ingredients":"8 garlic cloves"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 bay leaves"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 Roma tomatoes, quartered"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large onion, cut into eighths"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 dried guajillo chiles, stems and seeds removed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons ground cumin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons kosher salt, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 1/2 cups chicken broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"24 corn tortillas"},{"recipe_ingredients":"12 ounces cotija cheese, shredded"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 onion, diced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 1/2 cups shredded cabbage"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch radishes, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 limes, cut into eighths"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Combine pork shoulder roast, garlic cloves, tomatoes, onion, guajillo chiles, cumin, salt, and pepper in a large (5 to 6-quart) slow cooker; pour chicken broth over roast."},{"recipe_directions":"Cover, cook on High until pork is fork tender, 6 to 7 hours. Remove roast from slow cooker; allow to cool for about 10 minutes. Shred pork with 2 forks, discarding any fat or membranes."},{"recipe_directions":"Discard bay leaves. Pour cooked vegetables and liquid through a sieve; reserve cooking liquid and set aside. Place cooked vegetables in the bowl of a blender or food processor; blend to a smooth puree."},{"recipe_directions":"For dipping sauce, skim excess fat from cooking liquid; set fat aside. Return puréed vegetables and defatted cooking liquid to the slow cooker; cook, covered, on High until ready to serve."},{"recipe_directions":"Add a bit of reserved fat to a large skillet or comal over medium-low heat. Soften tortillas by warming on each side for 1 to 2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"To make tacos, place about a tablespoon of shredded cheese, 2 tablespoons shredded pork, and an additional tablespoon of shredded cheese on one half of warm tortilla. Fold other half of tortilla over filling; repeat with all tortillas."},{"recipe_directions":"Add a thin layer of reserved fat to the skillet or comal over medium heat. Place folded, filled tortillas in batches in the hot skillet; cook until golden, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Use a spatula to move any cheese that oozes out back into taco."},{"recipe_directions":"Ladle dipping sauce from slow cooker into individual serving bowls; garnish each bowl with shredded cabbage, radishes, chopped onion, and a squeeze of lime juice. Serve tacos warm, with dipping sauce."},{"recipe_directions":"Brenda Venable"}]

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Put chopped onion and sliced olives in separate small bowls and combine each with 1/4 cup of vinegar. Set aside to marinate. Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in the chorizo, breaking it apart into crumbles as it cooks, about 10 minutes. Remove the chorizo from the skillet and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat 1/4 cup of oil in the skillet and add the tortilla pieces, cooking and stirring over medium-low heat until just beginning to get crisp and golden at the edges, about 10 minutes. Remove skillet from heat and drain the tortillas; pour 1 tablespoon of the oil into a saucepan."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat the saucepan over medium-low heat until hot but not smoking. Add the flour, and cook and stir until smooth, about 1 minute. Pour in the regular and hot tomato sauces, water, browned chorizo, cocoa powder, sugar, 1 tablespoon of vinegar, oregano, and taco seasoning. Simmer the sauce about 5 minutes to blend the flavors. Stir in diced chiles and tortillas. Simmer about 10 minutes more, stirring occasionally, until tortillas have softened and the mixture is thick."},{"recipe_directions":"Drain the onion and olives. Spoon a layer of tortilla mixture evenly into a 2 quart baking dish or serving dish, and follow with a layer of about 2 tablespoons marinated onion, then a layer of 2 tablespoons olives, followed by a layer of 1/4 cup cheese. Repeat layers twice more. Serve hot."}]

Grease a 10x15-inch casserole dish."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine drained tomatoes and chipotle chiles in adobo in a blender; puree until smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Remove from heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix tortilla chips and tomato-chile sauce, folding carefully to cover chips completely. Season chicken with salt and pepper, then sprinkle with 1/2 of the green onions and 1/2 of the cilantro. Spoon 3/4 of the sour cream evenly over top. Spread with the remaining tortilla mixture then top with remaining Mexican and cotija cheeses. Cover with aluminum foil."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until mixture is bubbly and cheese is melted, 35 to 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and let sit for 5 minutes. Peel and chop once cold."},{"recipe_directions":"Place the bacon in a large, deep skillet, and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil."},{"recipe_directions":"Place poblano peppers onto the prepared baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Broil peppers in the preheated oven until skins blacken and blister, about 10 minutes, making sure to turn peppers halfway through cooking time. Keep remaining dredging flour available for Step 10."},{"recipe_directions":"To make the sauce, purée stewed tomatoes in a blender and set aside.
